sentences: Ta tundis oma käte ja jalgade ümber kammitsaid – ahelate kõlin tungis talle kõrvu.
Viibib üha oma mõtete, kunagise oletuse kammitsas.
context: The Estonian word 'kammits' refers to hobbles or restraining devices used on horses (and sometimes other animals) to limit their movement, typically for purposes like herding. More broadly, it can refer to any type of restraint, shackle, bond, or fetter that restricts freedom or movement - whether physical restraints, metaphorical constraints like outdated beliefs or traditions, or limiting factors in general.
